name: Master of Muppets Firmware - Enhanced Architecture
description: Advanced multi-threaded USB MIDI to 16-channel CV converter firmware for Teensy 4.1 with sophisticated threading model and production-ready optimizations

include/.description: Core header files and driver interfaces

dr_teeth.h.purpose: Global configuration constants and buffer management struct

electric_mayhem.h.purpose: Template-based multi-threaded DAC controller with advanced synchronization

muppet_clock.h.purpose: Global timing system with microsecond precision

drivers/.description: Hardware abstraction layer for DAC drivers

main.cpp.purpose: Main application entry point with threading setup

files.rob_tillaart_ad_5993r.cpp: AD5593R driver with retry logic and hardware configuration

FunctionGenerator.purpose: LFO and waveform generation for testing

core_architecture.overview: Template-based multi-threaded real-time system with hardware abstraction and advanced synchronization
design_patterns: Template-based polymorphism for compile-time DAC driver selection
Thread-safe buffer management with mutex protection
Sequence-based update tracking to prevent redundant operations
Hardware abstraction layer with standardized driver interface
Static memory allocation throughout (zero dynamic allocation)

the_voice_from_beyond.purpose: MIDI input processing with timing updates

the_muppet_show.purpose: Copies input_buffer to output_buffer with DAC worker coordination

muppet_worker[0].purpose: Dedicated worker for DAC 0 (AD5593R on Wire2, pin 11)

muppet_worker[1].purpose: Dedicated worker for DAC 1 (AD5593R on Wire1, pin 37)

party_pooper.purpose: Force refresh all DACs every 100ms to prevent stuck states

k_dac_count.description: Number of DAC chips in system

k_channels_per_dac.description: Channels per DAC (AD5593R has 8 configurable I/O)

k_total_channels.description: Total CV output channels (2 DACs × 8 channels)

k_thread_slice_micros.description: Thread slice duration in microseconds for low-latency

k_force_refresh_every_millis.description: Periodic force refresh interval to prevent stuck states

k_audio_half_scale.description: Half-scale value for bipolar audio signals

k_midi_to_framework_scale.description: Scaling factor from 14-bit MIDI to 16-bit framework

muppet_state.purpose: Per-DAC worker thread state with sequence-based synchronization

update_sequence.purpose: Sequence number for update tracking and duplicate prevention

orientation_guide.purpose: Passes references to worker threads for DAC operations

fields.output_buffer: Pointer to DAC-specific output buffer section

sequence_based_updates.mechanism: Each DAC worker tracks last processed sequence number
benefits: Ensures updates are processed exactly once

double_mutex_protection.description: Two-level mutex system for maximum thread safety

input_stage.processing: 14-bit MIDI to 16-bit internal conversion with offset correction

buffer_copy_stage.operation: Copy input_buffer sections to output_buffer sections per DAC
buffer_copy_stage.optimization: Direct memcpy for efficient block transfers

hardware_output_stage.local_buffers: Thread-local copies for atomic hardware updates
hardware_output_stage.conversion: 16-bit framework values to 12-bit DAC values via scaling

constants.k_channels: Number of channels supported by driver

methods.enable(): Enable DAC for updates (typically sets control pin LOW)
methods.disable(): Disable DAC after updates (typically sets control pin HIGH)
methods.set_all_channels_same_value(): Set all channels to same value
methods.set_values(): Bulk update all channels (preferred for efficiency)

polymorphic_design.mechanism: C++ templates for compile-time driver selection
polymorphic_design.usage: electric_mayhem<dac_driver_t> where dac_driver_t is the chosen driver

flags.-fomit-frame-pointer: Remove frame pointers for more registers

code_patterns.static_allocation: All buffers and structures statically allocated
code_patterns.template_polymorphism: Compile-time polymorphism for zero runtime cost
code_patterns.direct_memory_copies: memcpy used for efficient bulk transfers
code_patterns.compile_time_constants: constexpr used throughout for compile-time evaluation

threading_optimizations.dedicated_workers: Separate thread per DAC for parallel processing

latency_targets.dac_update: Direct hardware updates without buffering delays

jitter_reduction.static_allocation: No garbage collection or dynamic allocation delays

reliability_features.periodic_refresh: Force refresh every 100ms prevents stuck states

LFO_CHANNEL.usage: Uncommented applies LFO to all channels

DEBUG_CHANNEL.purpose: Channel to display on LED as intensity

runtime_monitoring.timing_functions: LED blink timing uses global clock

lfo_test_mode.purpose: Replace MIDI input with generated LFO signals
lfo_test_mode.waveforms: Multiple waveform options via FunctionGenerator library

production_mode.description: Normal USB MIDI to CV operation
production_mode.input: USB MIDI pitch bend messages on channels 1-16

test_mode.description: LFO testing mode for development and verification
test_mode.output: Synchronized CV signals on selected channels

hardware_initialization.fallback_behavior: Continue operation if DAC fails to initialize

periodic_refresh.purpose: Prevent DAC register corruption or stuck states

clock_overflow.handling: Subtract overflow amount to prevent float precision loss

naming_conventions.theme: Muppets characters and references throughout codebase
naming_conventions.rationale: Memorable names that reflect system behavior and relationships

system_components.dr_teeth: Band leader - core system configuration and coordination

thread_names.the_muppet_show: Main performance thread - coordinates the show
thread_names.party_pooper: Maintenance thread - keeps things running smoothly

method_names.go_muppets: Start the performance - trigger DAC updates
method_names.shit_storm: Force update all DACs (dramatic but memorable)

architectural: Sequence-based update tracking eliminates redundant DAC writes
Double-mutex system balances performance and thread safety
Template-based driver abstraction with zero runtime overhead
Dedicated worker threads per DAC for true parallelism
performance: Static allocation throughout eliminates garbage collection
10μs thread slices provide excellent real-time characteristics
Hardware FPU utilization for consistent floating-point timing
Compile-time optimizations with aggressive compiler flags
reliability: Comprehensive retry logic for hardware initialization
Periodic maintenance thread prevents stuck states
Clock overflow protection for long-running operation
Thread-safe state management with atomic operations
maintainability: Hardware abstraction layer enables easy DAC driver swapping
Self-documenting code with thematic naming conventions
Modular architecture with clear separation of concerns
